channel.title: IP Addresses on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in IP Addresses on 0x000216

item.title: The CJEU's ruling in C-582/14 Breyer establishes IP addresses as personal data.
item.description: Marcin Kotula, Legal Officer at the European Commission The opinions presented are solely those of the author and should not be interpreted as representing the European Commission’s official stance. Background The Breyer case saw the German Supreme Court (Bundesgerichtshof) request clarification from the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) on whether dynamic IP addresses constitute personal data under the EU Data Protection Directive and to what extent their storage and processing is permissible for maintaining website functionality.

item.title: Dude, Where's My Site?
item.description: Ever feel like the internet is taking a break, but you’re not sure if it’s just you? Sometimes, websites refuse to load, leaving you wondering if the problem is on your end. A new tool called DownForEveryoneOrJustMe.com provides a simple solution. Just enter the website address, and it will tell you if the site is truly down or if it’s just your connection. Created by a Twitter engineer, DownForEveryoneOrJustMe.com addresses the common question of whether a website is offline or if it’s a personal issue.
